text:
Seems like ICP.jl cannot handle non-strict inequalities if used with ModelingToolkit.
`
```julia> Separator(vars, f)
Separator:
  - variables: x, y
(@v1.5) pkg> st IntervalArithmetic IntervalConstraintProgramming ModelingToolkit
Status `C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\environments\v1.5\Project.toml`
  [d1acc4aa] IntervalArithmetic v0.17.7
  [138f1668] IntervalConstraintProgramming v0.12.1
  [961ee093] ModelingToolkit v3.20.1

julia> using IntervalArithmetic, IntervalConstraintProgramming, ModelingToolkit

julia> vars = @variables x y
(x, y)

julia> Separator(vars, x + y < 1)
Separator:
  - variables: x, y
  - expression: x + y == [-∞, 1]

julia>

julia> Separator(vars, x + y <= 1)
ERROR: MethodError: no method matching iterate(::Nothing)
Closest candidates are:
  iterate(::EzXML.StreamReader) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\EzXML\ZNwhK\src\streamreader.jl:184
  iterate(::EzXML.StreamReader, ::Any) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\EzXML\ZNwhK\src\streamreader.jl:184
  iterate(::LibGit2.GitBranchIter) at D:\buildbot\worker\package_win64\build\usr\share\julia\stdlib\v1.5\LibGit2\src\reference.jl:343
  ...
Stacktrace:
 [1] indexed_iterate(::Nothing, ::Int64) at .\tuple.jl:84
 [2] Separator(::Tuple{Operation,Operation}, ::Operation) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\IntervalConstraintProgramming\CQFKf\src\separator.jl:199
 [3] top-level scope at REPL[15]:1```
Is this normal?
